CSS_font-faceFont-variation-settings.summary: The font-variation-settings CSS descriptor allows authors to specify low-level OpenType or TrueType font variations in the @font-face at-rule. The values for this descriptor are the same as the font-variation-settings property, except for the global keyword values.

remarks.para: Since this descriptor sets variation values on the font object in the _font-face at-rule and not on an entire element, only some glyphs in an element may be rendered using this descriptor.

-Other _font-face descriptors: @font-face/font-display, @font-face/font-family, font-feature-settings, @font-face/font-stretch, @font-face/font-style, @font-face/font-weight, @font-face/src, @font-face/unicode-range
-Related font properties: font-feature-settings, font-variation-settings
